diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Growth Hormone Insensitivity Syndrome (GHIS) due to a homozygous mutation in the Growth Hormone Receptor (GHR) resulting in a GHR truncated after Box1.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis was supported by clinical findings of short stature, elevated growth hormone levels, and low levels of IGF-1 and IGFBP-3 in both siblings. Genetic analysis revealed a homozygous 22-bp deletion in the GHR gene, resulting in a frameshift mutation that truncated the receptor, confirming the defect responsible for the observed growth hormone insensitivity.
